text: we three sisters have lived in Raqqa in
Syria all our lives Raqqa was known as
the city of powerful women if you needed
anything here you had to speak to a
woman but the Islamic state changed that
they made us cover our faces told us not
to wear trousers to not leave the house
without a man who is responsible for us
our friends were forced to marry
soldiers were forced to be prostitutes
for them but the men tired of them
leaving them pregnant and alone is
created a female Islamic police force
they watched us they beat us they
searched us in inappropriate filthy ways
they spoke in tongues other than Arabic
my elder sister bickered with her
in-laws they reported her and she was
taken to the religious police the
husband they sent him sir - she was
lashed to many many times her body will
never recover they do much worse to
women who challenge their politics
believe them in a place nearby where
hyenas hunt they are eaten alive my
younger sister is in her early 20s she's
afraid to leave the house she sits with
my mother all day they will never leave
calm they do not listen to the radio as
the neighbor thinks it's hells pipes
they are afraid of being reported
I'm a mother did I tell you that my son
is eight I thought he was going to the
park but instead clerics were filling
his head with hatred they radicalized
him I told him he must stop speaking
with them he shouted you are an infidel
you are a pig he's not like that but
they have poisoned him against me I've
heard women whisper they wish the
uprising had never happened they wanted
freedom but they won oppression but God
is full of strangers in a you sir plan
raka has lost its soul
